sentence: Republican Arizona Senate candidate Blake Masters, Democratic Wisconsin Senate candidate Tom Nelson and Pennsylvania Democrat John Fetterman recently announced support for a ban.
title: What’s the plan, Chuck?

sentence: Rather than deny them, we can lift ourselves up by seeing them in a new light.” — “The Nonconformist,” by Laura Marsh in The New York Review of Books: “The mood of John le Carré’s posthumously published novel, Silverview, is brisk and knowing compared with the melancholic, regretful tone of the earlier books.” PLAYBOOKERS John Fetterman, fashion icon, donned a hoodie and gym shorts while meeting with Joe Biden at the site of the collapsed bridge in Pittsburgh.
title: POLITICO Playbook: Pundits to Biden: Here’s how to fix your presidency

sentence: A super PAC supporting Rep. Conor Lamb for U.S. Senate in Pennsylvania made two misleading claims about the Democratic front-runner, John Fetterman, one of which resulted in a Philadelphia TV station pulling the ad.
author: Robert Farley
title: Pro-Lamb Super PAC Misfires in Attack Ad Against Fetterman

author: Ed Morrissey
title: ABC, Punchbowl, Politico: Dems sure seem incoherent on immigration
